ivory.bloomir.data

Class CompressedPostings

  • java.lang.Object
    • ivory.bloomir.data.CompressedPostings
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Writable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompressedPositionalPostings

    public class CompressedPostings
extends Object
implements Writable
    A compressed postings list representation. This class uses PForDelta to compress a given set of document ids into blocks of equal size.
    Author:
    Nima Asadi

    • Method Detail

      • decompressBlock

        public int decompressBlock(int[] outBlock,
                  int blockNumber)
        Decompresses a block, stores the decompressed data in an array and returns the number of decompressed elements as output. To read the n_th element of this block, add outBlock[n-1] to the current value. That is: 
             original_data[0] = outBlock(0)
        
     original_data[1] = original_data[0] + outBlock[1]
        
     original_data[2] = original_data[1] + outBlock[2]
        
     ...
        
     original_data[n-1] = original_data[n-2] + outBlock[n-1]
        Parameters:
        outBlock - Array to store the decompressed values. Note that the size of this array must be at least equal to the size of each block.
        blockNumber - The block index to decompress.
        Returns:
        Number of elements in the decompressed array, starting from index 0.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object o)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • getBlockCount

        public int getBlockCount()
        Returns:
        The number of blocks in this postings list.

      • getBlockNumber

        public int getBlockNumber(int index)
        Computes the block number of a given index. For efficiency purposes we do not check the range of the input index against the number of elements in this postings list.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of an element in the original data
        Returns:
        Block number.

      • getBlockSize

        public static int getBlockSize()
        Returns:
        The actual block size.

      • getBlockStartIndex

        public int getBlockStartIndex(int blockNumber)
        Returns the index (in the original data) of the first element in the compressed block.
        Parameters:
        blockNumber - Block index.
        Returns:
        Index of the first value in the specified block.

      • getPositionInBlock

        public int getPositionInBlock(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - Index of an element in the original data
        Returns:
        Index of the element in the block.

      • isFirstElementInBlock

        public boolean isFirstElementInBlock(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - Index of an element in the original data
        Returns:
        Whether or not this element is the first element of a block. For more information on how to read the elements please refer to decompressBlock(int[], int)

        Compresses the given input and generates a new instance of this class.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        an instance of this class which contains the given data in a compresed format.
